alert.note: Alert for Eastern Franklin; Eastern Hampshire; Western Franklin (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 1:47PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Hampshire and southeastern Franklin Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 146 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hatfield, or near Amherst, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Amherst, Northampton, Deerfield, Belchertown, Ware, Montague, Hadley, Sunderland, Hatfield, Conway, Leverett, Shutesbury, Whately, Pelham, New Salem and Wendell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams.
